business.headline: Jewellery, coins, SGBs, ETFs: Why gold taxes differ so muchJewellery, coins, Sovereign Gold Bonds, gold ETFs, gold mutual funds, and digital gold may all mirror the same metal, yet each one produces a very different tax outcome. Read on to understand how gold taxation really works.

Capital gains tax was meant to be simpler. Here's why it feels harder nowSelling a long-held asset used to be a fairly predictable exercise. Inflation was factored in through indexation, the tax rate was known, and the final bill rarely came as a shock. That sense of certainty has faded.

What education sector wants from Budget 2026: Skills, quality and jobsWith India's youth population at the centre of its growth story, the education sector sees Budget 2026 as a chance to invest in better teachers, relevant skills and stronger pathways to jobs.

Tata Technologies' Q3 profit plunges 96% on one-time labour code chargeThe new labour rules, which came into effect in November, require employee wages to make up at least 50% of the total cost to company. Benefits such as provident fund and gratuity must now be calculated based on wages, raising costs for employers.

Gold and silver ETFs at record highs: Should you sell now or buy more?Gold and silver prices have climbed to record highs, pulling their ETFs up sharply as well. With returns looking attractive, investors are now facing a key question, i.e., is this the right time to book profits or stay invested? Let's have a look.

Will gold prices stay near record highs despite easing safe-haven demand?Gold prices are hovering near record highs even as some safe-haven demand fades, raising questions about whether support from interest rate cut expectations and global uncertainty will be enough to keep prices elevated.
Sensex, Nifty end higher driven by IT stocks; Infosys gains 6%The S&P BSE Sensex added 187.74 points to settle at 83,570.35, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 28.75 points to close at 25,694.35​​​​​​​.

Budget 2026: What India's middle class is really asking forWith Budget 2026 around the corner, India's middle class is hoping for relief that actually touches daily life, from jobs and inflation to housing and healthcare, so what is it really asking the government to deliver?

Are frequent market holidays holding India back as a global investment hub?In a post on X, Kamath said that shutting stock exchanges for a local municipal election shows poor planning, especially at a time when Indian markets have strong international linkages and global investor participation.

BCCL IPO listing date changed: Check new debut date, GMP and expected profitBCCL share price: Expectations around listing gains remain strong, as the grey market premium, or GMP, has moved higher. However, the stock's listing has been delayed, pushing the debut to a later date.

IMF likely to upgrade India's GDP forecast after Q3 growth exceeds expectationsIndia's third-quarter growth turned out to be better than expected. This has increased the chances of an upward revision in the IMF's outlook.

Can Budget 2026 address tax, talent and cost pressures in tourism and hospitality?Industry voices highlight the need for skilling reforms, tax incentives, and policy support to drive growth and innovation in India's tourism and hospitality sector.

Amagi Media Labs IPO: Should investors apply?Amagi Media Labs has stepped into the IPO market, drawing attention from investors keen on the fast-growing connected TV and streaming space. With positive brokerage views and steady grey market signals, the key question is whether the issue is worth subscribing to.

Infosys shares rally after Q3 FY26 results: Should you buy now?Infosys stock: The stock opened at Rs 1,670.30, touched an intraday high of Rs 1,683.45 and a low of Rs 1,654.55. The 52-week high of the stock stands at Rs 1,967.75, while the 52-week low is Rs 1,307.10.

Sensex jumps 700 points: Why is the stock market rising todayAt around 10:09 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 410.60 points at 83,793.31. The NSE Nifty50 also moved higher and was trading up 99.80 points at 25,765.40.

Infosys share price jumps 5%: Why is the IT stock rising todayInfosys reported deal wins worth $4.8 billion in the third quarter, a sharp jump from $3.1 billion in the previous quarter. Around 57% of these deals were classified as net new, indicating fresh business additions rather than renewals.
Sensex, Nifty rally as IT stocks jump in early trade; Infosys gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex added 358.23 points to 83,740.94, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 87.55 points to 25,753.25 as of 9:54 am.

TCS headcount dips sharply: Why is India's IT sector facing a job crisisAt the end of Q3 FY26, Tata Consultancy Services said its total headcount stood at 582,163, down by 11,151 employees from 593,314 at the end of the September quarter.

Sensex, Nifty today: Stock markets likely to open higher. Here's why?Market participants are now waiting for earnings announcements from other large companies. Results from firms such as Reliance Industries, Wipro, HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank are expected later on Friday and on Saturday.
Not so 'strait': Hormuz, Iran, and the global oil tradeAround 84 per cent of the crude oil and condensate transported through this strait goes to Asian markets.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss Kannada 12 grand finale live: Kichcha Sudeep to announce winner soon Kichcha Sudeep will host the Bigg Boss Kannada 12 grand finale today, which will begin at 6 pm. Bigg Boss Tamil 9 finale live updates: The grand finale of Vijay Sethupathi-hosted Bigg Boss Tamil 9 is all set to begin at 6 pm today. Divya Ganesan, Aurora Sinclair, Sabarinathan and Vikram are the finalists who are fighting for the trophy.

Nora Fatehi breaks silence on Bhushan Kumar affair rumours Actor-dancer Nora Fatehi responds to revived social media rumours linking her to T-Series chairman Bhushan Kumar, following a TikTok post referencing a five-year-old Reddit thread.

Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa reveal baby girl's name, share first photo Actors Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa have publicly introduced their newborn daughter, Parvati Paul Rao, through an Instagram post. The announcement, which included a message and a family photograph, has prompted congratulatory responses from fellow actors and fans.

Chinmayi defends AR Rahman amid Vande Mataram claim; Meerra weighs in Music composer AR Rahman has come under scrutiny after comments made in a recent interview, resulting in criticism on social media. Singer Chinmayi Sripada and actor Meerra Chopraa have taken to online platforms to defend him.

She-llain rising: The Bollywood bad girl is turning disturbingly real The female villain gets a darker edge with the current crop like Amma in Mardaani 3 and Badi Didi in Delhi Crime 3. But does today's uncomfortably real she-llain owe her origin to vamps of yore? Read on.

Did you know Bridgerton actor Luke Thompson is quarter Indian? Actor Luke Thompson, known for his role as Benedict in Bridgerton, has shared that he is a quarter Indian, citing his grandmother's heritage.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9 grand finale countdown: 4 finalists and a season of ugly fights The grand finale of Bigg Boss Tamil 9 is set to air on Vijay Television and JioHotstar on January 18. Vijay Sethupathi hosted the show this season that kickstarted on October 5.

Refused to meet me: Kangana recalls her AR Rahman experience during Emergency Bollywood actor Kangana Ranaut has publicly criticised composer AR Rahman for declining to meet her regarding her directorial film Emergency, alleging prejudice and partiality.

Don 3 casting rumours debunked as insiders deny Atlee, Hrithik Roshan link Speculation regarding the involvement of director Atlee and actor Hrithik Roshan in Don 3 has been dismissed by sources close to the project.

Ram Charan gets into beast mode as he gears up for Peddi shoot Behind-the-scenes glimpses of Ram Charan's physical preparation for the rural sports action film Peddi emerge, as the production team gears up for upcoming schedules.

Allu Arjun spends family time in Tokyo with Sneha Reddy and children Allu Arjun, currently in Tokyo to promote the Japanese-dubbed version of Pushpa 2: The Rule, took time off from his commitments to visit the Sensoji Temple with his family, sharing moments with his wife Sneha Reddy and children in Japan's capital.

Vijay's Theri vs Ajith's Mankatha: Amid Jana Nayagan row, clash of re-releases The 2016 action drama Theri, starring Vijay, is set for a theatrical re-release on January 23, coinciding with the re-release of Ajith Kumar's Mankatha.

Ajith Kumar chats with Nayanthara, Vignesh Shivan at Dubai 24H Series. Viral video Actor Ajith Kumar's racing pursuits, including his participation in the Dubai 24H Series, are set to feature in a new docu-film by director A L Vijay. How big is the loss?A report about India's strategic withdrawal from Iran's Chabahar port triggered a political slugfest between the Congress and the BJP. Experts suggest the Chabahar story is less about an exit and more about managing strategic ambition under Trump sanctions.

Is friendflation making us lonely?With the prices of everything increasing, young Indians are finding that inflation is not only making daily life difficult but forcing many to cut back on socialising and reshaping friendships. Here is how young people in urban India are navigating friendflation, and what experts suggest could help in such situations.

Noida techie dies screaming for help after car plunges into 30-foot drainA 27-year-old man died after his speeding car went out of control, broke a drain boundary, and plunged into a water-filled basement near Sector-150 in Greater Noida.

Trump's new 'Board of Peace' comes with $1 billion price tag for permanent seatsUS President Donald Trump's proposed Board of Peace is taking shape, with Gaza as its first focus and global ambitions beyond. A draft charter shows nations may need to pay $1 billion to secure permanent membership, as per a Bloomberg report.

Macron's 'tiger's gaze': Why internet thinks there's more than meet the eyeFrench President Emmanuel Macron's recent public appearance with a bloodshot eye and sunglasses led to widespread social media discussion and revived scrutiny of online harassment targeting his wife Brigitte Macron.

Thinking of studying in Ireland? Indian students share brutal realityHandcrafted ByOur Editors Thousands of Indian students arrived in Ireland chasing a dream, but what they found was nothing like they expected. Every step forward seems to come with a new, unseen hurdle. Why does the Irish dream feel more like a nightmare? Students share the harsh truth.

He was begging for help: Delivery agent who tried to rescue drowning techieA delivery agent risked his life and tried to rescue a 27-year-old software engineer, who drowned after his car plunged into a drain amid dense fog. While he heard cries for his help, he was unable to locate him.

Pakistan activist's SOS after TLP death threats for saving Hindu girlsAn SOS from a Hindu rights activist from Pakistan's Sindh has revealed that speaking up against forced conversions of minor Hindu girls can attract death in Pakistan. Shiva Kachhi has alleged that the banned Islamist group TLP has issued fatwa threats against him for speaking against forced conversions and the government was simply looking away.

On hold: EU freezes trade pact with US after Trump's tariff over Greenland demandThe European Parliament has halted the US-EU trade deal ratification after Donald Trump imposed new Greenland-linked tariffs. Lawmakers warned that the zero-tariff pact cannot proceed and that they would prepare possible countermeasures under the anti-coercion rules.

2026's biggest lifestyle shift? Living life on analog modeOn Instagram, a new trend is emerging: people are sharing their analog journeys - replacing digital habits with physical, hands-on experiences.

AR Rahman is telling half the truth; his music lost its genius after 2015In a recent interview, AR Rahman blamed his recent Bollywood slowdown on non-creative power shifts and communal whispers. Truth is, his post-2015 duds contributed to his decline.

Fine on IndiGo too low: Pilot body chief asks why no action against any officialsThe Federation of Indian Pilots has criticised the DGCA for imposing what it termed an inadequate fine on IndiGo over widespread flight disruptions in December 2025, alleging the inquiry covered only a limited period and failed to fix individual accountability.

Denmark is tiny, it can't control Greenland: Trump aide defends takeover proposalWhite House Deputy Chief of Staff Stephen Miller said Greenland is one-fourth the size of the US and that Denmark cannot defend or control it. He called Arctic competition the new domain of national security.

Trump aide Navarro's fresh rantWhite House trade advisor Peter Navarro has sparked fresh controversy by questioning why Americans are paying for AI services in India. He added that platforms like ChatGPT run on US soil using American electricity, while serving users abroad.

Will schools in Delhi, Noida, and Ghaziabad shift to hybrid classes amid severe AQI?Delhi-NCR continues to struggle with worsening air pollution, leading authorities to reimpose GRAP-4 restrictions. Amid the ongoing harsh winter spell, parents and students are on edge, awaiting an official decision on the next steps.

sports.headline: Daryl Mitchell boosts No.1 ODI hopes with back-to-back centuries vs India India vs New Zealand: Star New Zealand batter Daryl Mitchell once again came to New Zealand's rescue, slamming his second successive and fourth overall ODI hundred against the Shubman Gill-led India in Raipur.

Fangirl Sabalenka clicks selfie with Federer, Laver after gritty Aus Open opener Aryna Sabalenka had a fangirl moment with Roger Federer and Rod Laver as she clicked a selfie with the tennis legends after her gritty first round win on Sunday, January 18. Sabalenka defeated Tiantsoa Rakotomanga Rajaonah to make it to the second round.

I would cry every day in front of my dad: Harshit Rana on overcoming failure Harshit Rana shared how he used to handle failure and the role his father played in helping him overcome adversity during his early days. Harshit has found himself to be a favourite of India coach Gautam Gambhir.

Steve Smith breaks silence on Babar Azam fallout rumours in BBL | Watch Australia batter Steve Smith on Sunday played down reports of a rift with Pakistan's Babar Azam following their on-field exchange in the Sixers' BBL game against Sydney Thunder.

Tata Steel Chess: Erigaisi beats Praggnanandhaa, Gukesh draws in opening round Arjun Erigaisi secured a swift victory over Praggnanandhaa while D Gukesh settled for a lengthy draw against Javokhir Sindarov as the Tata Steel Masters opened with upsets and strong performances. Keymer and Niemann also emerged victorious, sharing the early lead as the first round featured decisive play and high-profile draws.

T20 World Cup: England's Pakistan-origin players receive visas, others to get soon The International Cricket Council (ICC) is facilitating visa formalities for 42 players and officials of Pakistani origin ahead of the T20 World Cup in India. The move is aimed at ensuring their smooth participation in the tournament, despite the additional scrutiny typically faced by visa applicants of Pakistani origin travelling to India.

Arshdeep Singh returns for series-deciding ODI after social media backlash India vs New Zealand: Arshdeep Singh returned to the Indian playing XI as captain Shubman Gill won the toss and opted to bowl against New Zealand in the third and final ODI in Indore.

Arthur Fery stuns 20th seed Cobolli to make his mum's marathon trip worthwhile Australian Open: Qualifier Arthur Fery produced a stunning upset on Sunday, defeating 20th seed Flavio Cobolli to ensure his mother's long journey from Britain was rewarded with at least another match to watch him play in Melbourne.

Long queues frustrate fans as ticket sales halted on opening day Australian Open organisers came under fire on the tournament's opening day on Sunday (January 18, 2026), as frustrated fans endured long queues outside Melbourne Park and complained of confusion following the sudden suspension of ticket sales.

Rohit Sharma's piece of advice that Harshit Rana will never forget, video goes viralHarshit Rana's 4/39 in the Sydney ODI silenced critics, but it was Rohit Sharma's simple on-field advice — leading to an instant wicket — that left a lasting impression and has since gone viral.

India tough place to play: Phillips plays down history talk ahead of final ODINew Zealand batter Glenn Phillips admitted the prospect of scripting another chapter of history in India was "pretty cool" but insisted his side would lean on process and adaptability rather than emotion as they chase a rare white-ball series win against a formidable host.

However, Harleen Deol has been dropped from the T20I setup, following her underwhelming returns in shortest format so far.

Vihaan Malhotra's Houdini act helps India pull off miracle rescue vs BangladeshU19 World Cup: India pulled off a Houdini act in the group-stage match against Bangladesh on Saturday, January 17. Australian Open 2026: Melbourne gives Roger Federer the farewell it never couldRoger Federer's return at the Australian Open opening ceremony turned emotional as he recreated an iconic ball-boy catch, shared the stage with legends and finally received the farewell he never had.

Manchester United's Michael Carrick era starts by denting City's title hopesManchester United started their Michael Carrick era by outplaying Manchester City and denting Pep Guardiola and his side's title charge with a 2-0 win on Saturday, December 17.

Change World Cup groups: Bangladesh propose radical idea to avoid India travelBangladesh have proposed the idea of changing their group for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 to minimise their travel to India. The BCB has released a press note on the developments from the meeting.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
